title.narrative: 5.2 EDUCATION

description.narrative: UNICEF EAPR has strengthened capacity to design and implement gender responsive, equity focused EDUCATION programmes that deliver results for the most disadvantaged children at scale., which contributes to Equitable Access To Quality Education, Learning Outcomes, Skills Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: COs practice programming excellence to achieve quality results for children at scale in both development and humanitarian settings

participating-org.narrative: PROVINCIAL EDUCATION AND SPORT SARAVANE PROVINCE MINISTRY OF EDUCATION

sector.narrative: Technical assistance - Equitable access to quality education

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: UNICEF EAPR has strengthened capacity to design and implement gender responsive, equity focused EDUCATION programmes that deliverresults for the most disadvantaged children at scale.

description.narrative: The EAP COs continued to receive a variety of technical support from the RO Education Team to tackle the unprecedented challenges posed by the COVID19 pandemic in its second year, which further exacerbated the inequities in education access and learning among the most vulnerable children and adolescents. Key priorities at country level were to provide effective continuous/remote learning opportunities during school closures while ensuring safe school reopening and operation, wellbeing/protection and learning recovery programmes. The RO has provided technical assistance/guidance, supported resource mobilization, data collection and evidence generation, and exchange of good practices/lessons, for reimagining education for EAP countries. | Status:Met | As-of Date:29/03/2022
